page.title: 14Customs In Hoo.
page.content:
Around Hoo there are many customs and different superstitions about the supernatural and the village. The main customs and festivals are the main Christian ones,e.g.Christmas, Whitsun and Easter.{Rogation}is a custom in danger of disappearing.This concerns the thanksgiving for the crops and exports and imports of the Parish,and involves a procession round the boundaries of the village.Many customs however are now extinct such as The Maypole Dancing on the recreation grounds and many of the differant fetes.There was once a centenary in memory of{Thomas Aveling}who is buried in the churchyard.This will most probably never occur again during the next decade.
{ BY A FORD, N MUDIE, J WOOSTER, {L TILBURY AND S BEADLE.
